content.webTitle: Barcelona 5-1 Athletic Bilbao | La Liga match report

fields.headline: Barcelona's Lionel Messi closes on Müller mark as Athletic Bilbao wilt
fields.bodyText: Lionel Messi scored twice as Barcelona made their best start in La Liga with a 5-1 home win over Athletic Bilbao. The league leaders' 13 wins and a draw from their opening 14 fixtures surpasses Real Madrid's 12 wins and two draws at the beginning of the 1991-92 campaign. The milestone, unmatched in 81 previous seasons, has come in the first year of Tito Vilanova's tenure as manager . Messi's 11th double-strike of the season leaves him one goal shy of Gerd Müller's record of 85 for club and country in one calendar year, set in 1972. Barcelona led 3-0 at half-time thanks to goals by Gerard Piqué, Messi and Adriano. Cesc Fábregas and Messi, again, then also scored in the second-half. Bilbao did their best early on to fight for possession with Barcelona, and with their passing game checked the hosts were forced to turn to a set piece to break through – Piqué pouncing on 22 minutes after the visitors had failed to fully clear Fábregas's corner. Messi struck for the first time three minutes later before Adriano also scored following a through pass from Fábregas. The former Arsenal captain scored himself on 57 minutes after collecting a pass from Andrés Iniesta and Messi made it 5-1 on 70 minutes following a goal from Ibai Gómez for Bilbao.
